website_summaries.verdict: Good tone for a low price, and we particularly love the multitude of gauge preferences and playing styles that these strings are designed for.
pros: Available in a wide range of gauges and styles of play, including bluegrass and Nashville tuning
Long-lasting strings at a good value
cons: Some players felt these strings were too bright and became worn too easily
More string squeak than with coated strings

customer_reviews.title: My favorite string for over 51 years.
customer_reviews.text: I am 59 years old this year and have been playing guitar since I was 8. I have tried every string on the market and I always come back to these D'addario's. And kick my self in the butt for trying something new. I have been a Master Luther for more than 30 years and set all my acoustic guitars weather they are 6 string or 12 string guitars to use these strings in this gauge. It has taken me all this time to learn my lesson. Stick with the best and screw the rest. They sound incredible, last forever. They are easy on the fingers and bend notes high and crisp. I love them. I do, I do!
customer_reviews.author: R. P.

customer_reviews.title: a solid 3
customer_reviews.text: I don't think these strings can withstand long plucking. Nor do I feel that they gave me the sound I was going for, which was troubling due to the price.
customer_reviews.author: si.yrxkrru1t3177Top Contributor: Coloring

customer_reviews.title: Always have and always will love phosphor bronze
customer_reviews.text: D'addario is what I've always used. Always have and always will love phosphor bronze! A set usually lasts a long time for me, so this pack of 3 will last for a while. I personally like the light gauge for its clean, crisp sound that I have always loved on both my Yamaha gfx and my Ovation. My neighbor uses the mediums that are sold on this listing, but I would recommend the light gauge as a better overall sound. Thank you D'addario!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I went extra light mainly for the feel and easy bending.
customer_reviews.text: They sound good, feel good, and look good! What else is there? Oh, they make me happy. :-)
customer_reviews.author: J.C. Moore

customer_reviews.title: Best strings for the buck!
customer_reviews.text: I've tried quite a few brands of acoustic strings. My favorite ones are these D'Addario custom lights, D'Addario lights, Martin 80/20 bronze, and Paradigm lights by Ernie Ball. Of all of them I'd say the Paradigm slightly edges out the D'Addario. However, they also cost about 15 bucks a set. The Martins are beautiful when fresh but quickly fade and tarnish within a couple weeks seems to me. Hands down I prefer the D'Addario custom lights. Great tone that lasts and lasts and seem more durable than most. Best bang for the buck and actually sound better overall to my ears than the regular lights.
customer_reviews.author: RES2525

customer_reviews.title: These are light enough to make playing fun again and still retain some of the low end ...
customer_reviews.text: I do a lot of Guitar setups and use a few different types of strings. These are light enough to make playing fun again and still retain some of the low end sound of more heavier strings. They last about as long as most strings and are a real bargain if you change strings a lot. I recommend them for professionals that need good sound and change strings often to keep that brand new string feel and sound. You can't go wrong with them unless you sweat all over them and don't wipe your strings but then again they are cheap enough to just throw another set on.
customer_reviews.author: Jason A. AdamsTop Contributor: Guitars

customer_reviews.title: Living off a name...
customer_reviews.text: This review is for D’Addario EJ17 Phosphor Bronze Acoustic Guitar Strings. I bought a three pack of them, because they've always had a stellar reputation. Unfortunately for me, two out of three sets were bad. The first set lasted about a year - amazing! The second set, the G string broke after only a couple hours of playing. The third set, the G string broke while tuning! Both times it appears that the core became brittle and snapped, allowing the brass to unwind itself. Looks like I'll be switching to the much more affordable (and about as long-lived) Ernie Ball strings, as I have asked D'Addario for support on this matter multiple times with zero replies.
customer_reviews.author: Howling Coyote

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Restrung my daughters accounting guitar for the first time. First time ever restringing a guitar. So I didn’t have the right tool but was successful. Strings didn’t pop. I like the color at the bottom to help me with placement. Sounds good enough to me
customer_reviews.author: Trevor Gull

customer_reviews.title: Big on the top and small on the bottom.
customer_reviews.text: The strings all came in different sizes and winds. I was able to install them and tune correctly but each and every one sounds *different*. Once I figured out how to mash them on the fretboard, music was forthcoming. Perhaps this is how it is supposed to be? My girlfriend was so proud AND I didn’t even poke out my eye! They sound nice just like new strings should but I have noticed they don’t tune themselves so I had to knock them a star for being willful.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I got fakes and back they went!
customer_reviews.text: The EJ24's that I got were FAKES and NOT the real deal. Cardboard feel to the package instead of that familiar waxy feel and the string bag was not vacuum packed either. Also no codes on the plastic bag. D'Addario strings are top notch quality but these were just plain fake. Sent them back. Be careful when purchasing.Bought my replacement set through REVERB. Guaranteed NOT FAKE. -v-
customer_reviews.author: Vince52

customer_reviews.title: Excellent, killer custom guage acoustic guitar strings
customer_reviews.text: D'Addario has been my go-to string manufacturer for many years. I recently tried their Custom Light Guage strings (.011 - .052) and LOVE them. The lighter weight strings really improve playability of my guitar and make string bending much easier, yet the strings aren't too light to damage tone. I absolutely adore these strings. They can make a HUGE difference in your guitar playing. Try a set and you should see and feel a considerable difference in your guitar. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: L. Williams

customer_reviews.title: Not Real D'Addario Strings
customer_reviews.text: These are not real D'Addario Strings. They came wrapped in plastic with a "Made In China" lapel on it. Real D'Addario's are made in the U.S. If you look at YouTube, Phillip McKnight's video on counterfeit strings, it'll give you the rundown on how to spot fake D'Addarios.
customer_reviews.author: PHud

customer_reviews.title: Can’t go wrong with these
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been using these on all my acoustic guitars for like 15 years now. They sound great on just about any guitar but of course always use your ears and decide for yourself. They tend to wear out pretty quickly for me but I have real sweaty hands, don’t always keep on top of wiping strings down after playing, and I tend to like my strings sounding really crisp so I tend to change them more often than usual anyway. Sound great, are durable, and affordable. Strings are always a personal preference but if you’re thinking of trying these for the first time these are definitely worth your while. I’d recommend them to players of any level.
customer_reviews.author: Bill P.Top Contributor: Guitars

customer_reviews.title: buyer beware
customer_reviews.text: inside the box I found 2 out of the 3 sets of strings had previously been opened, they are individually sealed to keep the air from oxidizing (corroding) the strings. Acoustic strings are greatly affected by this and they generally have a short life span where they sound optimal due to the natural aging of the strings thru not only playing but being exposed to air. It appears these were returned at some point and resold as new to me, buyer beware.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I'm Really Beginning To Like These
customer_reviews.text: These are lighter than the .13's that came with my Yamaha FS800. I love that they are coated. They did however sound a bit "odd" and "rattled" while tuning for the first few weeks. Now that they've settled in, the sound gives me the bright on the B and High E, but keeps the base on the Low E, A, and D. I was skeptical at first, but now, I'm satisfied with them. I do plan to try a "non" coated string in a light gauge to see if I like the overall sound more. As long as you are patient with the "breaking in" process, these strings will not disappoint.
customer_reviews.author: pd01

customer_reviews.title: Great tone
customer_reviews.text: Love these strings, made my 20 year old Larrivee sound even better. I'd always used lights on it, but opted for these since I was getting some fret buzz on the bass strings. Guitar plays great on all strings. Excellent for DADGAD tuning, which is the main tuning I use for this instrument now. Really like the combination of gauges on this set. Highly recommended. Have been using phosphor bronze strings since they first came out many years ago, they have the best tone of all acoustic steel string types imo.
customer_reviews.author: Dee O'Keefe

customer_reviews.title: Love the sound of these strings . . . .
customer_reviews.text: I have tried many, but always have found myself back to these! The sound is wonderful, they are warm, rich, and full, yet bright enough to bring out the harmonics and overtones you prize from your instrument. I much prefer the un-coated strings . . . while the coated (EXP or Elixer type strings) last longer they do not sound quite the same. I much prefer to buy these and change them more often to maintain my sound, I can change these 2 or 3 times for the same cost and my guitar always sounds it's best.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: They are the real deal.
customer_reviews.text: I use these strings on my Gretsch Square Neck Box Car resonator guitar. As I understand it, these are the strings that it came with and are the recommended ones. The combo of the guitar and strings sounds perfect to me. The one thing I was apprehensive about was whether these would be fakes or genuine. As soon as I got them, I used the D'Addario system for verifying that they are real and registering the code numbers to help prevent anyone else from getting fake strings with this brand. Turns out they are genuine and the exact product number I ordered here on Amazon. Good price too.
customer_reviews.author: Moondog

customer_reviews.title: Worth the Purchase.
customer_reviews.text: Music stores are like skateboard shops; they're fewer and fewer and farther and farther in between. I'm always a little eerie about buying something from amazon that I would normally talk to an experienced salesman about, but so far *knock on wood* I haven't had too bad of luck in buying products from amazon that are worth the purchase. These strings are what they are advertised to be, and they've lasted me quite long enough to where I feel like they are worth the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Jakob lee c

customer_reviews.title: Great strings!
customer_reviews.text: I play 12-string guitars and have both an Ovation Custom Balladeer and an Adamas, and I've never used anything but D'Addario EJ41 extra lights on them. I need the extra light strings (.009 - .045) because my fingers can't handle thicker strings, and I don't like the way the thicker strings *sound*. These strings sound bright and lively, and they really do last for a very long time. I tried other makes of strings on other guitars I've had and find that these D'Addarios are absolutely the best.
customer_reviews.author: Babasongbird

customer_reviews.title: I like 'em
customer_reviews.text: Acoustic strings, more so than electric, in my opinion, are much more subjective... I've tried a lot of acoustic strings, and some don't seem to last a week before going 'flat', some are brighter than others, some are just plain crap... these are decent (I don't want to use the word "budget", but will) ---budget strings... they sound good, to my ear, last plenty long, and the price is right... Yup! they are good...... if I were to have a 'complaint' , it would be the novelty of the colored ball ends,,,, I wish they'd knock that off!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Capo2

customer_reviews.title: Great strings, decent price
customer_reviews.text: Great strings, decent price. Probably not any cheaper at your local guitar store, and while I am all for supporting local business it is nice not have to a hipster up-sell you. Also there is always that guy shredding metal poorly, Amazon doesn't make you deal with him either.. These are lighter strings, so they won't be as loud (this will vary on the body of your guitar also). Additionally they may be a little easier to play on if your fingers are not in shape, or if you want to play quietly. Conversely, though, you will not be able to beat on them, because they will break more easily. High quality strings though.
customer_reviews.author: P. J. Fry

customer_reviews.title: Really, these are a benchmark set of strings.
customer_reviews.text: Warm, just the right amount of brightness, what's not to like about these strings? I've been comparing these to D'Addario's Nickel Bronze, and, while I love the fact I can get 5+ months out of the NB's, I really like the tone of the EJ16's a little better. I hate coated strings, especially Elixir's, which squeak like a stuck pig for me. I guess I'm just relegated to string changes every 3 months and I'm OK with that.
customer_reviews.author: Ed

customer_reviews.title: Feels weird. My pair were cheap or defective.
customer_reviews.text: I cannot recommend these strings. The top strings feel way too loose in contrast to the lower strings. It feels weird to play. Plus one of my strings seemed defective it broke after 2 or 3 days. It was the G. I've never had a G break on me before. Sure the B or the high E but never the G.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: I've always used these strings and never, ever had a problem BUT this time i did :(
customer_reviews.text: I got a defective set.. Low E and A strings were Fine and so was the High E string BUT the G and B strings were defective. B string was badly bent at several points that as soon as i tried to tune it, it snapped! Same with G string, The G string wasn't bent but it was unwinding and when i tried tuning it, it just snapped, this time it stabbed at my arm, so...that hurt. :( :( :(
customer_reviews.author: Loth

customer_reviews.title: Great strings for beginner and pros
customer_reviews.text: I love these strings on my acoustic guitars. Originally I bought them for my daughter, who was just learning at the time, but I found that I really enjoy the feel and sound of these strings for my own guitars. I am a semi-pro player. I was surprised to like them so much because generally I use thicker gauges for pro playing. For my electric guitars, I always use 11's, but I have re-strung my acoustic guitars with these extra-lights.
customer_reviews.author: Fuse

customer_reviews.title: Quality, affordable strings
customer_reviews.text: Maybe I was just unlucky, but two of the high E strings broke when I restrung the guitar. So now I have two sets of strings with no high E, which is what breaks most frequently. If only they sold packs of just high Es, eh? In any case, the sound quality is great for the price, no complaints there! They did tear up my fingers for the first few days (I hadn't played in weeks, however) - this never happened with Elixr Nanoweb strings, but that was to be expected. If you're looking for affordable, good-quality strings and don't mind taking the time to build up callouses, these are the strings for you!
customer_reviews.author: Chris Cirefice

customer_reviews.title: The Best My Seagull S6 Has Ever Sounded
customer_reviews.text: I recently purchased an Ibanez guitar that came strung with these exact strings. It sounded so crisp and present that I ordered 3 sets for my other acoustics. I have a 22 year old Seagull S6 that has always sounded a little dull on the 5th and 6th strings even after a pro set up. I restrung with these EJ16 Lights. After a couple of days of break in, this guitar sounds full, clean, and loud. I'm just a camp fire hack, but Austin is full of amazing guitarists -- lots of whom are my friends. I can't wait to hear my guitar (and these strings) in the hands of a true player.
customer_reviews.author: BradleeMan

customer_reviews.title: Cannot be  tuned!
customer_reviews.text: I have been playing for more than 20 years and all i can say is those strings are garbage! I never had a problem with dadario before but those are weird! Sound is not right and they cannot be tuned! Just warning buyers. Dont waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: stkr

customer_reviews.title: I wanted to like these
customer_reviews.text: but I can't recommend them. My normal string is the Elixir phos bronze mediums. My supplier was out, so I substituted these. The price is right. Playability, tone and longevity are all severely lacking, however. I also have to tune every time I play. Not so with my other strings, they stay put for weeks once dialed in. Anyway, the mediums are back in stock, and I'll be switching back.
customer_reviews.author: D. Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Good sound on
customer_reviews.text: Good strings for Taylor "Grand Auditorium" body style. I put a set of these EJ19s on my 814CE, and now am enjoying the sound. Great bass, nice bendable mids and highs. Minus one star for being stiffer than Elixir HD lights, which have a similar mix of light top - medium bottom. I had to tighten my truss rod slightly to compensate. Will try to come back in a month or two to report on longevity.
customer_reviews.author: John Shalamskas

customer_reviews.title: Bright, long lasting, full sound
customer_reviews.text: I got these originally when I had my Ibanez acoustic serviced at a very good shop near Baltimore. The strings lasted a long time (I only play in my house but practice quite a bit) and sounded so good that when I went back to see the shop I asked about the brand of strings. Since then I have restrung my guitar once with these and got this set for a good friend to put on her Martin. Really like the sound even when they have played for a while.
customer_reviews.author: Laura Weeldreyer

customer_reviews.title: So much better
customer_reviews.text: I got my first acoustic as a long standing electric guitar player and man those strings were heavy! The guitar came shipped with 12-53 strings, which is great if you want to play in C Standard or the likes, but I wasn't planning on tuning that low. These 10-47s were perfect. Heavy gauge strings sound nice, but I didn't notice a difference switching to these lighter strings, and playability skyrocketed. I don't think I'll buy anything else for my acoustic than these.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Strings
customer_reviews.text: I have a yamaha acoustic guitar and tried these strings for the first time. I really like it, the string sound is great, the strumming feels great as well. The price is affordable and the quality is good and don't feel they will break that soon. I prefer little bass on my strumming and these strings offer that. I know there are already great reviews out there for this string and that is why I bought it reading the reviews, but I still thought to share my personal experience.
customer_reviews.author: Ladu Birla

customer_reviews.title: Not used to this type
customer_reviews.text: I normally use coated string and I decided to give these a try. There are less expensive but I noticed that the wound string are more grabby. That is there is more friction and my fingers seem to slide less freely up and down the fretboard. I also notice a bit more string squeak with these. I'll switch back to coated strings. I recognize that this is a matter of preference and I expect that those who use these strings would probably have some adjustment if the switched to the coated strings. So, to each their own. Happy playing....
customer_reviews.author: Brian Smith

customer_reviews.title: Full Rich Tone!
customer_reviews.text: No complaints with the strings; made in USA and sound beautiful on my Breedlove Dreadnought. Thinking about ordering some Custom Lights (EJ26) for my Martin (Finger-style), and I've never used anything other than Martin brand strings on it. The packaging could have been better, one corner of the cardboard string package was crushed from being passed through the mail in a padded envelope. I was afraid some of the strings would be kinked. I've used one of the three sets thus far, and they are good to go. We'll see with the other two sets in time. Gotta give the full five stars to the strings though, love 'em!
customer_reviews.author: Chief Swabbee

customer_reviews.title: Great strings, sound wonderful, put them on an old dobro
customer_reviews.text: I bought two sets because I am a rookie, and sure enough, I broke one. So I learned about tensioning, and installed the second set, Perfect !! I tuned the dobro to GBDGBD and these sound great. I am going to order these for my other guitars as well. One thing I learned was check the gauge that is appropriate for your instrument, and you wont be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: OldGuy57

customer_reviews.title: For LOW tuning. Stiff in D standard!
customer_reviews.text: I've been playing guitar and bass for 20 + years. My ESP KH-2 has Dean Markley Blue Steel 13s made for lower tuning. They are tighter in d standard than most strings tuned to E. After learning my Dean Exhibition's pickup works by vibration I decided to get some nice acoustic strings for better sound. I am literally afraid to tighten these strings up to E. if you're playing is more advanced than Cowboy chords avoid these strings. I physically cannot play Moonlight Sonata in D standard! These things will not buzz in B standard!
customer_reviews.author: Arlan

customer_reviews.title: Good strings
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these strings along with the EJ26-3D's, a pin set stage rocker, guitar strap, capo, string winder and guitar tuner as a Christmas present in 2013 for a guitarist friend in Canada and completely forgot about leaving a review. I have used D'Addario strings on my own guitars and been happy with them. I know he was thrilled with the items and was pleased with the quality but sadly he passed away in 2015. I am grateful to have found items that he enjoyed from companies that shipped to Canada as so few on Amazon did at the time.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best acoustic strings ever.
customer_reviews.text: I have used these strings for about 10 years now... been playing since 1983, finally found strings that last, keep their brightness even after long gigs and they keep their tune. Love the three pack. Perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Denise and Jason Gabbard

customer_reviews.title: My favorite.
customer_reviews.text: These have been my go to string for over thirty years now. On both acoustic and electric guitars D'Addarrio has served me well. With a couple minor exceptions with the use of some GHS strings, I will always go to these. I prefer these over the much costlier Elixer by far. They are brighter and last just as long. Plus they are awhole lot cheaper in price. Especially if you order them through Amazons subscribe and save program. I play Taylors exclusively, and as I said, except on two low end Taylors, I use only these. If you haven't tried them, give them a shot. I think you'll be pleasantly surprised.
customer_reviews.author: MRH

customer_reviews.title: Recommended by my local Guitar shop.
customer_reviews.text: I'm a beginner on the acoustic guitar and broke a string already. My guitar shop recommended these as the best all-around strings for acoustic guitars, hands down. I bought a set from the shop but then found them here for half the price so ordered another set for when I invariably break another string. So far, the set I put on looks and sounds great (at least to me, but then I have no "ear" for guitar notes/chords yet).
customer_reviews.author: GadgetGuy

customer_reviews.title: 5 Stars A++ RECOMMENDED Easy on the fingers Good tone Great Sustain
customer_reviews.text: RECOMMENDED Light and sweet toned. Not as heavy as standard, but good if your vintage instrument needs lighter strings. Easy on the fingers for those new to 12 string guitar. Long lasting. These did tune right up, and stayed tuned pretty well from the start. I do recommend wiping down your instrument and the strings to remove the acid from your fingers. This will improve the durability of the strings. 5 Stars A++ RECOMMENDED VOTE thumbs UP IF YOU FOUND THIS HELPFUL
customer_reviews.author: DaPoppa1

customer_reviews.title: Nice clean bright sound
customer_reviews.text: I put these on my horrible sounding guitar about a year ago and they made it sound so much better, bright and clear. A year later I started getting a bad buzz and ringing. Got the same strings and they sound great again. I'll see how long these ones last. I do play quite a bit, so for the price of strings, I really should change them more often anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Brown

customer_reviews.title: Very good strings
customer_reviews.text: These are great sounding acoustic strings. Very good quality. This is the first time I've tried them, I'm very pleased with the sound. They make my guitar sound better then it really is. I've tried coated strings, they just don't seem sound as good to me. I'll most likely keep using these strings on my acoustic guitars and try their electric guitar strings also..
customer_reviews.author: L. Herren

customer_reviews.title: D'Addario strings
customer_reviews.text: I needed to replace my strings on several of my guitars, and could not find my go to strings (Gibson Masterbuilt) strings. It appeared all my suppliers were temporary out of them. Needing to replace them soon, I took a chance using these.strings. To my surprise they sounded great. If in the future if can not order my regular brand, I would buy these again.
customer_reviews.author: Rich H.

customer_reviews.title: High quality strings consistently.
customer_reviews.text: Very old, but very nice Guild- D55 sounds amazing with extra light D'Addario strings. Smaller diameter strings make it easier to play,and not so tough on your finger tips. D'Adarrio makes very good strings in medium 13-56 also for bluegrass players. I haven't tried the others,but I suspect they are high quality as well.
customer_reviews.author: Don Smith

customer_reviews.title: My go to strings
customer_reviews.text: I'm not a professional musician but I've been through my fair share of strings and these are my favorite. I think they are fairly priced and not overly glossed over which was my issue with lots of other strings. If you're a beginner or a expert with an acoustic I recommend them. They feel nice against the fingers and work well with my guitar.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: My favorite strings, period
customer_reviews.text: How many dozens of brands and models have I tried over the years? These are by FAR the best and most consistently pretty strings I've ever bought. I used to mess around with testing other strings every time I bought a new set, but now I just get these in bulk and string all my guitars with them. I guarantee that you will, at worst, think these sound pretty good, and at best you'll not want to play anything else (assuming you like uncoated strings, I guess).
customer_reviews.author: Tyler F

customer_reviews.title: Definitely rely impressed with the low cost but good quality!
customer_reviews.text: Restrung my cheap acoustic guitar and these worked great! Easy to string, color coded to make sure you’re putting them on the right spot (for noobs like me) and sound great!
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: I needed to get used to soloing on an acoustic with thicker strings but overall the experience is HUGELY better. I play outside
customer_reviews.text: I tried these string on a lark. I've been using Earthwood Rock & Blues (hybrid [53-10]... fatter bottoms, thinner tops) for years. These string just kick their ass in every way. I needed to get used to soloing on an acoustic with thicker strings but overall the experience is HUGELY better. I play outside all the time in the Florida heat and humidity, if you keep these wiped down they don't corrode as fast. I was previously having to change my strings weekly... now I get about two weeks out of a set (that's 12-20hrs of playing).
customer_reviews.author: RobK

customer_reviews.title: EXCELLENT guitar strings!!
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic strings, as always! I have been using D'Addario strings for MANY years and will continue to do so, because I've always preferred VERY light strings, and D'Addario have always proven to be the finest to me, for thinness and excellent sound quality. I have them on my Gibson J45 AD, my Epiphone DR-212 12-string and my Rogue. If you haven't tried them yet, TRY THEM! You WON'T be disappointed! And for $9.39 Prime, you can't go wrong!! One happy camper, I am I am....
customer_reviews.author: Allie

customer_reviews.title: Great sound quality, great string feel
customer_reviews.text: These strings will give your guitar a more "earthy" or "woody" tone, which I like. I would describe it as balanced with maybe a slightly lean on darker side. The string feel is incredible--they are very stretchy and the bends feel amazing. Only downside is that they aren't coated as heavily for elixers so sliding your fingers on the strings does produce some noise, but it is quieter than other string brands. Also, because they aren't coated quite as heavily they do corrode more quickly than other strings brands I've used. That being said, these are my favorite strings and my go to on all my guitars. Elixers would be my second choice.
customer_reviews.author: Wesley Smith

customer_reviews.title: Good strings
customer_reviews.text: Just put the last set of a pack of three D’Addario strings that I had ordered from Amazon. I treat my Taylor guitar worse than I do my wife and the strings don’t break! And guitar strings can't request a restraining order ! Even with the high humidity here in S Florida putting on these new strings really make it sound like I can actually play !
customer_reviews.author: Steven M.

customer_reviews.title: My Favorite Strings
customer_reviews.text: After 30+ years of guitar playing I've been playing D'Addario strings exclusively for the last 10 years. I find they hold up well in lots of playing spaces and last a long time although I typically change them frequently. I've had good luck with these strings and I'm going to continue using them.
customer_reviews.author: SirBill94

customer_reviews.title: I've been happy with D'Addario's so I have no reason to change
customer_reviews.text: My stand by strings for years. I've tried other coated string and for the price I don't think there worth it, these last as long as I want them too and more. 3 packs save money and give me some extra packs as a back up. I've been happy with D'Addario's so I have no reason to change. I used to use the medium but have played with the lights for a while, just easier on my fingers. Sounds bright and crisp tone. Not sure if they're the best, just what I've become accustomed to and I'm glad to be picking with them. Also eco-friendly and economical.
customer_reviews.author: Bob E.

customer_reviews.title: Extra lites are amazing, easy on the fingers and sound great
customer_reviews.text: Excellent strings. I’ve just recently picked back up the guitar and wanted something a little easier on the finger tips. The “extra lites” are amazing. Makes my acoustic much easier to play. The sound is amazing as well, I can’t tell a difference in these and larger gauges in regards to tone. Bottom line, I don’t see buying anything but these in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Noj

customer_reviews.title: You can't go wrong with D’Addario strings...
customer_reviews.text: I know there are a lot of cheap no-name strings on the market, but if you spend good money on a guitar you should pay for quality strings that sound great. You can't go wrong with D’Addario strings. Don't risk buying anything else, protect your guitar and the sound of your guitar playing.
customer_reviews.author: HearMeOut

customer_reviews.title: GREAT STRING QUALITY
customer_reviews.text: 50 YEARS OF PLAYING GUITAR. BEST STRINGS IVE EVER USED. BRIGHT, GREAT FOR MY 52 YEAR OLD YAMAHA, MY 37 YEAR OLD OVATION, AND SOUNDS GREAT ON MY NEW KEITH URBAN ACOUSTIC. GREAT LONG LASTING STRINGS, AND GREAT VALUE. YOU WON'T BE SORRY. I PREFER 11 GAUGE HOPE THIS HELPS YOU STAY SAFE !
customer_reviews.author: lee

customer_reviews.title: snapped instantly
customer_reviews.text: I put on the strings and before I could hear the note that would say I'm in tune, the instrument whiplashed and I was missing a string. If these strings can't at least last a tuning, they are worthless.
customer_reviews.author: John S James Jr

customer_reviews.title: The first set I received - first string broke when ...
customer_reviews.text: The first set I received - first string broke when tuning first time. Amazon promptly replaced it with another set and first string broke three days after I put it on a guitar.
customer_reviews.author: Alex S

customer_reviews.title: Not the best for me.
customer_reviews.text: I'm a big fan of the sound of fresh strings and these have just that right amount of talk. It seems to stay only for a few days though. I learned with the very first pair not to use any cleaners because then the strings just completely crap out leaving a dull muddy tone that's unappealing. The second set worked great and I just wiped it down with microfiber but the fresh string sound also dulled after about a week. I'll be going to back to acoustic slinky's because the sound lasts for a lot longer. Might be good for other guitars/guitarists, just not for me.
customer_reviews.author: Thisisacomputernerd

customer_reviews.title: Best all around acoustic/electric strings for any size venue
customer_reviews.text: I've tried every brand conceivable. Hands down, these are tonally crisp, clear and bright, play the best and don't corrode as fast as any of the others. I was with D'Addario for a long time and then tried other strings. There are none out there better and the Phosphorous Bronze and they sound great just in a small room or in a large venue on an acoustic/electric guitar!
customer_reviews.author: Tynan

customer_reviews.title: Good strings
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these strings along with the EJ17-3D's, a pin set stage rocker, guitar strap, capo, string winder and guitar tuner as a Christmas present in 2013 for a guitarist friend in Canada and completely forgot about leaving a review. I have used D'Addario strings on my own guitars and been happy with them. I know he was thrilled with the items and was pleased with the quality but sadly he passed away in 2015. I am grateful to have found items that he enjoyed from companies that shipped to Canada as so few on Amazon did at the time.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Garbage
customer_reviews.text: These strings sound awful, and were immediately tarnished. I had them on my guitar for a couple of days before I gave up and changed for some decent strings. I bought a couple of sets of these and really wish I hadn't. I'd rather not have strings than think I could pick up my guitar with these on and be so disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: wesssstexas

customer_reviews.title: Great deal on a highly rated product.
customer_reviews.text: I have been playing guitar for 50+ years so I have used D'Addario strings many times and they are very good quality strings. The 3 pack I purchased here made it a super good deal. My guitar sounds great with these strings and at this price I can change strings more often to keep a good quality sound.
customer_reviews.author: William B.

customer_reviews.title: Great strings
customer_reviews.text: These are my go to strings on all my guitars. I play out semi-professionally and have been using the for years. Get'em and ignore the "string snobs" who want to feel better about themselves for spending 3 times as much for the same thing. Get'em and play music!
customer_reviews.author: Russ Haire

customer_reviews.title: Good for C# Tuning on 12-String Acoustics
customer_reviews.text: These strings are great for dropped tunings on a 12-string acoustic guitar. I have a set of these on a 1989 Seagull S12 and tune them down to C#. Most string sets out there are "extra light" (.010-.047-inch) for 12-strings, but they flop around and buzz when tuning down. Plus, this set lasts a relatively long time for untreated strings.
customer_reviews.author: Frederick and JoAnn Roberts

customer_reviews.title: Great customer service
customer_reviews.text: These arrived as described, but while restringing my e string randomly snapped in half. This was before any tension was on the string, however after contacting the company they not only replaced the string but sent me a full set as well. They had prompt customer service and now my guitar sounds bright and warm. I got the custom light tension. They do not stain or blemish after a week of playing like some other brands might. Will be buying again.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley F.

customer_reviews.title: These were original equipment...
customer_reviews.text: I put these on a Gretsch Resonator that I was sorting out for a friend. The standard light (0.012) gauge were the original equipment strings. I selected the custom lights to make it a little easier on the fingers of a novice player. The custom light gauge sounded great on the resonator (despite the slightly lighter weight).
customer_reviews.author: Paul Helmuth

customer_reviews.title: Great tone
customer_reviews.text: I decided to take an old acoustic I had lying around and "converted" it into a baritone. These heavy duty strings work well. I've tuned down from standard E to C and these hold up well in that tuning. It's sort of a slack-key set (true baritone goes down to B, I think). Anyway, it provides great tone and for me, being a baritone singer, I can sing all my favorite tenor songs by McCartney, Paul Simon and others without having to transpose.
customer_reviews.author: George Paolini

customer_reviews.title: Best strings ever
customer_reviews.text: Don't even mess around with other strings on a good acoustic. I have been using these for thirty years. I've tried all kinds of other strings. These tune better, sound better and stay good and intonate better than anything else on the market. I just put a set on a vintage Martin that had lousy bronze strings on it and the D's brought that 000-18 back to life.
customer_reviews.author: joe normal

customer_reviews.title: Martin DRS-1 experience
customer_reviews.text: I play the acoustic guitar for many hours a week and my hands can get pretty sweaty, so I put whatever strings I buy through a pretty heavy gauntlet, and these perform well for longer than most strings, even coated Elixirs. My Martin DRS-1 uses these strings beautifully, giving a perfect balance of full and bright tones when unplugged. When I plug in, I notice it’s hard to take out the highs that can make it sound twangy but that’s expected with an acoustic. I put in anywhere between 14-20 hours a week on these and change them about every two weeks.
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: Nice stings
customer_reviews.text: I got a Yamaha from the pawn shop, restringed it and it was amazing! I'm just beginning to play (Yousician) but I do know what a good guitar sounds like. I've been surrounded by musicians all my life. These strings are solid and have a really. Ice sound. I also put a set on my son's beginners guitar.
customer_reviews.author: Mardaffen

customer_reviews.title: Great Strings
customer_reviews.text: I have used D’Addario strings religiously since 1999. Nice selection to choose from and always sounds great. Last a while too but I also play my guitar regularly which helps with string life. Nice action improvement on cheap guitars even if just a little.
customer_reviews.author: Gene Hawkins

customer_reviews.title: Great sound with these new strings!
customer_reviews.text: I am really impressed with the great sound quality I am getting an my old Fender acoustic. Strings came individually wound and you could tell the quality craftsmanship on these strings. Again, really nice product, brings out the best in your guitar...
customer_reviews.author: Tony R.

customer_reviews.title: These strings sound dead
customer_reviews.text: I wish I could like these strings! Obviously based on reviews, folks do like them - but they don't work for me at all. The sound is dead from the get-go. The price point is great, but I will got back to paying double the amount to get a sound that shows off my guitar. The difference in sound quality is like night and day.
customer_reviews.author: J. S. Marsh

customer_reviews.title: So far, so... OK
customer_reviews.text: They aren't my favorite strings, but they get the job done and still sound decent. I will try another brand before I use the other two sets, but I will eventually use them all. They are a great value though, if that is what you are looking for.
customer_reviews.author: jay

customer_reviews.title: last a long time
customer_reviews.text: I play hard, and I play a lot. These are a bit different from the Martins I usually buy, but I'm starting to like them. Not quite as "bouncy" for lack of a better word. The action is fine, but I'm used to a different feel. But overall they sound good and they have stayed bright through several hard playing sessions and performances. I think I will buy again.
customer_reviews.author: lovetoread

customer_reviews.title: Fave acoustic strings.
customer_reviews.text: I’m a guitarist of 28 years, and a professional guitar teacher for 11. These have hands down been my favorite strings. I play a Taylor 210e, And even though I occasionally use Elixirs here and there, I always wind up back on these. They sound great, seem to last forever and feel awesome. Not much else to say!
customer_reviews.author: Mike G.

customer_reviews.title: Way above average strings
customer_reviews.text: When I first started playing 12 string they were the only choice I could readily find. (About a thousand years ago) Turned out to be fine as they have been a good choice right from the get go. Very bright, long sustain. Last forever. Have yet to break a string even when left on for years. Price has even dropped over time. A great standard.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Crum

customer_reviews.title: G / 3rd String Keeps Breaking!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have used these strings for some time now. I have always loved the sound of them, but recently I have had several G / 3rd strings break during tuning. No...I'm not over tuning (20 years of experience playing). No...it's not the guitar. I have used the strings on my Ovation and my Martin 000-CXE and the G-string has busted on both multiple times each. I will be trying something different next time.
customer_reviews.author: Cody D.

customer_reviews.title: Good strings for the price
customer_reviews.text: Strings sound really nice, easy to tune. And they stay in tune. However I noticed a few days after not playing my guitar, that the hi E, B, and G strings are rusted along the fret board. Not a huge deal, and I’m sure they’ll clean up with use, but I thought it was worth mentioning
customer_reviews.author: Coty Walters

customer_reviews.title: Great deal
customer_reviews.text: I expected a 12-string set to cost twice as much as a 6-string set, but it was more or less the same and the quality seems fantastic. I've used D'Addario strings in the past so I knew I was getting a good set. I'll buy these again for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Lucas H.

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive and sound great
customer_reviews.text: For a day or two they’re super bright like most new strings, but then they settle into a really balanced and beautiful tone on my dreadnought. Eventually they get dull sounding so get a few packs to have on hand - they’re affordable. Pretty comfortable to play and they bend well.
customer_reviews.author: JAtlanta

customer_reviews.title: Deep bronze tone. Distinct low E.
customer_reviews.text: These sound distinct and they prove what bronze sounds like. The low E is deep and resounding, often carrying bass lines when finger picking. The high strings are slightly lacking resonance, but that may be my low quality acoustic. Overall, they're very good. 9/10
customer_reviews.author: Paul Servary

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: I had to wait for my husband to tell me about this product before I wrote my review. He's very pleased with the quality of these strings and was able to string his guitar himself. They are a great product for the money and he'd choose these strings again.
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: Great action on my Ovation.
customer_reviews.text: Love the great action I get on my Ovation Balladeer, I play lead, blues, etc., that require a lot of bending and they hold up well. Have not broken any, and am getting a good couple of months before I feel the need to change because of tone. I also use Martins, and like these strings as much. Martins seem to be a little brighter, but the D'Addario makes up for that in the action. Good strings, you won't be disappointed. I play almost every day and my first experience with these strings has been good. Will use again.
customer_reviews.author: Capt Dave

customer_reviews.title: Not good
customer_reviews.text: It’s bad. I’ve used these D’Addario strings before and they worked great. This is first time buying them online. I don’t what happened, but 2 strings broke. One while restringing and another one happened while I was playing, keep in mind I only used these for 2 days. It sounds kind of tinny and I don’t like the sound. These are great strings but I recommend that you buy them from your local music store instead.
customer_reviews.author: Brenda

customer_reviews.title: Average
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these replacement strings based upon a friend's recommendation. These strings were supposed to be a set of three with five guitar picks included. I received the strings? No picks included. Not a major fault, but poor business sense in my opinion. Strings are average to me, nothing special.
customer_reviews.author: Carl Pyrdum

customer_reviews.title: Big Fat Sound!
customer_reviews.text: Big fat sound! I Love these strings. Heaviest you can buy in a set (that I can find). Great for alt tunings/fingerstyle and tuning low. If you are not used to heavy strings your fingers will hate you. I've been playing for 16 years and these strings CAN shred off my callus's when playing prolonged periods of time...but that fat sound is worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Trail JunkieTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Didn't improve my playing ability
customer_reviews.text: Thanks to these strings, I can still play like someone that can't play a guitar. It would be unfair to deduct stairs due to my own inability to play. Bought a guitar that needed strings and the reviews were good and the price was right. Sorry, I can not offer a legitimate critique.
customer_reviews.author: Danny D.

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding sound a definite keeper
customer_reviews.text: I put these on a thirty year old Alvarez dreadnought guitar. I can't believe how good it sounds. They took no time to stay in tune. I can't say enough about how good they sound regardless on your play style, pick or finger style. I will buy again.
customer_reviews.author: outidon

customer_reviews.title: Good strings
customer_reviews.text: D'Addario always gives you a good product. I have used many of their strings through the years, and never had a dud. I was bringing a badly beaten acoustic back from oblivion, and restringing was the final step. These tuned up well and sounded good on the erstwhile derelict acoustic. No complaints here.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Tracy

customer_reviews.title: Good value; don't expect long life
customer_reviews.text: These strings sound good. But they will oxidize fairly quickly, so don't expect to replace them only once every six months. Probably best to wipe them down after each session if you want them to last longer.
customer_reviews.author: Smitty

customer_reviews.title: Welpp, the strings broke already
customer_reviews.text: It didnt last long for me. The high-E string broken already. I was just playing casually one afternoon and it gave out. And now I need to wait a while before getting another string because it is not particularly essential. I wish D'Addario had better QC that this doesnt need to happen. Oh well
customer_reviews.author: Fitria

customer_reviews.title: great strings for acoustic guitar
customer_reviews.text: I've been using D'Addario strings on my acoustic guitar for years. I know Keith Urban uses them on his electric guitar and I liked the way it sounds on his playing. So I gave them a chance and have been happy with them ever since.
customer_reviews.author: Z

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for practice
customer_reviews.text: Bought the EJ16 Phosphor Bronze Light, 1 Pack Chosen because I wanted something I wouldn't have to change every month. Not particularly loud, but light strings are fun to bend, and they're easier on the hands. I'd recommend these corrosion-resistant light strings for players who play for extended sessions, or who play casually and don't want something that requires a dehumidifier and frequent maintenance. I'd use them for practice, or lessons, or chilling with friends, but not for recording or performing. In other words, use these for when it doesn't really matter.
customer_reviews.author: Nic

customer_reviews.title: G string may break
customer_reviews.text: I was tuning these up and could just feel the G (3rd) was going to break and it did. The guage is just a little too heavy (.028). So I pulled out and elixer nanoweb .025 and put that in and it went right up to G easily and sounds great. I'm going to pay more attention to my guages and adjust my string sets from now on.
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Play, Sound Great
customer_reviews.text: I just bought my first guitar a few months ago and was having the worst time playing the medium strings that came with it (they were not D'Addario strings). My guitar teacher suggested I buy light strings, and told me D'Addario were the only brand he used. I can tell you that having these strings on my guitar has made a big difference in my playing. Not only easy to play, but they sound great, and this is a great price as well for three sets of strings. My highest rating for these, and I hope to be using them for many years to come.
customer_reviews.author: Jack M. Walter

product_meta.title: D'Addario EJ16 Phosphor Bronze Acoustic Guitar Strings, Light
product_meta.description: Style:1-Pack| Size:Light, 12-53Pursue your passion with D’Addario’s most popular acoustic guitar string set, the Phosphor Bronze Acoustic Guitar Strings. Pioneered by D’Addario in 1974, phosphor strings are known for superb tone and comfortable playability. These light acoustic guitar strings help you achieve amazing performances, as they offer a warm, bright and balanced acoustic tone with excellent intonation. They have become the stage and studio choice of top guitar professionals worldwide. D’Addario leverages centuries of string-making experience to bring you the most durable, consistent and enduring guitar strings. Made in the USA for the highest quality and performance, only D’Addario strings are sealed inside and out. They feature a precision wound corrosion resistant phosphor bronze wire that is carefully drawn around a hexagonally shaped, high-carbon steel core. The result is long lasting, bright sounding tone with excellent intonation. And thanks to the environmentally , corrosion resistant packaging, the strings are always fresh. The string gauges in this acoustic string set include: Plain Steel .012, .016, Phosphor Bronze Wound .024, .032, .042, .053. The six "edges" of the core wire bite into the softer wrap wire, securing it all along its length. Since 1905, D’Addario has been providing artists and players with the tools they need to perform their magic. As musicians ourselves, we have the unique ability to engineer products that inspire other musicians. The D’Addario family’s vision, creativity, passion and tradition have made us the world’s largest musical instrument string manufacturer. We put our family’s heart, soul and love for making music into every string and instrument accessory we create, and we never stop inspiring performance.
feature_bullets: MOST POPULAR – Pursue your passion with D’Addario’s most popular acoustic guitar string set, the Phosphor Bronze Acoustic Guitar Strings. Since 1974, phosphor strings have been known for superb, long lasting tone and comfortable playability. They are the choice of professionals worldwide.
INSPIRING PERFORMANCE – These light acoustic guitar strings help you achieve amazing performances, as they offer a long lasting, warm, bright and balanced acoustic tone with excellent intonation.

CORROSION-RESISTANT – These strings feature a precision wound corrosion resistant phosphor bronze wire that is carefully drawn around a hexagonally shaped, high-carbon steel core. The result is consistent, long lasting tone.
STRING GAUGES – The string gauges in this acoustic string set include: Plain Steel .012, .016, Phosphor Bronze Wound .024, .032, .042, .053.

MADE IN THE USA – D’Addario leverages centuries of string-making experience and advanced computer-controlled winding technology to bring you the most durable, consistent and long-lasting guitar strings. Made in the USA for the highest quality and performance, only D’Addario strings are sealed inside and out.

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.7 out of 5 stars13,933 ratings4.7 out of 5 stars
